Created an attachment (id=80370)
WSDl that causes the failure

Build ID: M20070921-1145

Steps To Reproduce:
1. create a WSDL
2. open Web Service Wizard on it
3. choose Axis2 runtime
4. hit Next

More information:

This is a known problem that we plan to fix in WTP 2.0.2.  If you look further down in the stack trace, you will find the following:

Axis2 runtime is not set at web services preferences page!! Please set the web
services runtime by navigating through preferences.

We need to make that message more prominent rather than in the middle of the stack trace.

In short, before creating Axis2 Web service using WTP, you'll have to download Axis2 v1.2 or v1.3, unzip it and go to Preferences -> Web Services -> Axis2 preference -> Axis2 runtime to set it to the directory you unzipped Axis2 in.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 184450 ***

Axis2 is installed and i did set the web service runtime. I just rechecked it. Preferences / Web Services / Axis2 Preferences has Axis2 Runtime Location set, it says "Axis2 runtime loaded successfully".

I looked throught the backtrace before posting the bug report and the message you mention _is not there_.

The cause for this fault is something else.

Soma additional bits:
- Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0_03-b05, mixed mode)
- eclipse-SDK-3.3.1-linux-gtk-x86_64.tar.gz
- axis2-1.3-bin.zip

Andrea, a couple of observations:

1. I noticed that you are using Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.6.0_03-b05).  Have you tried using Java 1.5 instead of Java 1.6?

2. I noticed that the stack trace has:

org.eclipse.core.runtime.CoreException[0]: java.lang.NullPointerException
    at
org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.resources.VirtualResource.getReadOnlyComponent(VirtualResource.java:317)
    at
org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.resources.VirtualResource.getProjectRelativePath(VirtualResource.java:141)
    at
org.eclipse.wst.common.componentcore.internal.resources.VirtualResource.getWorkspaceRelativePath(VirtualResource.java:107)
    at
org.eclipse.jst.ws.internal.common.J2EEUtils.getWebContentPath(J2EEUtils.java:1151)
    at
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.core.utils.FacetContainerUtils.pathToWebProjectContainer(FacetContainerUtils.java:56)
    at
org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.facet.commands.Axis2WebservicesServerCommand.executeOverride(Axis2WebservicesServerCommand.java:101)

So I suspect this problem might have something to do with something unusual about the project you are creating. Is your dynamic Web project created at the default location or did you created a linked project?  Did you have any non-default setting when creating the Web project?


Lahiru, over to you to look at this problem for WTP 2.0.2.

Switched to "Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.5.0_13-b05, mixed mode)", problem still the same.

All settings are at default, no unsuals settings (as far as i know). workspace, Axis2 and Eclipse are both on an NFS volume.

I tried Tomcat5.5, Glassfish v2 and JBoss 4.0 as deployment target, same problem.

traces.message: Failed while installing Axis2 Web Services Core 1.1.
